annotation.spannedText: a sufficient portion of the population must be immune to an infectious disease (by vaccination and/or prior illness), so that the disease is less likely to spread from one person to another

annotation.spannedText: most diseases require vaccination rates as high as 80% – 95% to prevent outbreaks

annotation.spannedText: The vaccines risks are very low

annotation.spannedText: Most vaccine reactions are usually minor and temporary

annotation.spannedText: Very serious side effects like severe allergic reactions are extremely rare and are carefully monitored and investigated

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine benefits definitely outweigh the vaccine dangers

annotation.spannedText: Its publication started a panic among parents that led to dropping vaccination rates, resulting in subsequent outbreaks of vaccine-preventable diseases
